title: Substituting Nuts and Chocolate in Baking

items.name: Bittersweet chocolate -> Semisweet chocolate
items.details: Use equal amounts of semisweet in place of bittersweet. To mimic the slight bitterness, add 1-2 teaspoons of Dutch-process cocoa powder to balance the sweetness.

items.name: Pecans -> Hazelnuts
items.details: Adds a more distinct, slightly sweet and nutty flavor. Use as a 1:1 replacement.

items.name: Pecans -> Walnuts
items.details: Gives a more traditional texture. Use as a 1:1 replacement.

items.name: Milk chocolate note
items.details: Milk chocolate is sweeter and milder than both bittersweet and semisweet. Semisweet is the better substitute for bittersweet.

notes: Also includes parchment sling technique: cut parchment longer than the pan so it overhangs two sides. Grease the pan first, press parchment in, and optionally add a second sheet perpendicular for full coverage. This makes it easy to lift baked goods (like brownies) out of the pan for clean cutting.
